02/13/2009 (F) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.

02/21/2009 (Sa) - Received next movie.
02/22/2009 (Su) - Watched Hidden Fortress (1958), which I'll drop off today or tomorrow, using the Milwaukee (PO Box 3079) mailer I received it in. (Ended up mailing it Sunday.)
02/24/2009 (T) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
02/25/2009 (W) - Received and watched The New Kids (1985), which I'll drop off tomorrow.
02/27/2009 (F) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped. (Henceforth, MRNOS.)
02/28/2009 (Sa) - Received and watched Spawn (1997), since I couldn't recall it. I'll drop it off tomorrow (probably) or Monday. (Dropped off Sunday.)
03/03/2009 (T) - MRNOS.
03/04/2009 (W) - Received and watched The Man Who Knew Too Little (1997); I haven't laughed that hard in a while. I'll drop it off tomorrow using the Milwaukee (3079) mailer I received it in.
03/06/2009 (F) - MRNOS.
03/07/2009 (Sa) - Received next movie.
03/08/2009 (Su) - Watched The Eel (1997), for the second time; the first being when I lived downtown for the first time. I'll drop it off today or tomorrow morning.
03/10/2009 (T) - MRNOS.

03/14/2009 (Sa) - Received next movie.

Part two of year three continues.

item.title: Netflix shipping, for Madison WI - Year 2
item.description:
I had previously written on how Netflix shipped and received DVDs, for Madison WI. This article continues that one, by discussing Year 2 with Netflix (first year began September 26, 2006).

Plan changes

On December 2, 2007, I decided to upgrade to the two at-a-time (unlimited) plan. Since my plan begins on the 10th of each month, that means I had to pay an extra $1.26 to upgrade now, instead of for the next month (I figure this way they'll send a movie out tomorrow morning).

As of January 10, 2008, I'll be back on the 1-unlimited plan, since House should be back on the air. As always, I'll continue to track my progress below.

As of February 22, 2008, I'm back to 2-unlimited.

As of April 28, 2008, House is back on, but on Mondays. Since I get so few movies on Monday, I'll be staying with the 2-unlimited plan.

As of May 7, 2008, since I'm getting busier, I'm downgrading to the 1-unlimited plan, as of May 10.

As of July 25, 2008, I'm back to 2-unlimited. I've got almost 200 movies in my queue, so I got to knock that down a bit.

I changed my plan back to 1-unlimited August 29, 2008, and that should take effect September 10. When I received my confirmation email, it seems that on 9/10 I'll get my 15% discount, because of the shipping problems. However, that applies to that month's plan price. Switched back to 2-unlimited.

View my queue, in RSS format.

View my FeedFlix page.

The times

09/27/2007 (R) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
09/28/2007 (F) - Received next movie.
09/29/2007 (Sa) - Watched GoodFellas (1990) and put into the mail to Madison.
10/01/2007 (M) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
10/02/2007 (T) - Received and watched Outlaw Star: Vol. 1: Disc 2 and put into the mail to Madison.
10/04/2007 (R) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
10/05/2007 (F) - Received and watched the very excellent 3 Days of the Condor. Wow. Put into the mail to Madison.
10/08/2007 (M) - Movie received by Netflix, and next one shipped. The email says I can expect delivery on Wednesday. This day is a Federal holiday, hence no mail.
10/09/2007 (T) - Received next movie.
10/10/2007 (W) - Watched Constantine (2005) and put into the mail to Madison. Great movie, but for some reason I couldn't give a 5/5, as much as I'd really like to ...
10/12/2007 (F) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
10/13/2007 (Sa) - Received and watched The Island (2005) and put into the mail to Madison.
10/15/2007 (M) - Watched Six-String Samurai (1998) online. The moral? Stay away from attachments; they'll kill you dead.
10/16/2007 (T) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
10/17/2007 (W) - Received and watched The Magnificent Seven (1960) and put into the mail to Madison. I think I liked the original more, since it's rather Americanized.
10/19/2007 (F) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
10/20/2007 (Sa) - Received next movie, but watched The Brood (1979) first, which Rob Lumley was kind enough to lend me. The one thing I don't like about the movie is the ending; I'm not sure why we're shown what we're shown (are they more than tears?) ...
10/21/2007 (Su) - Watched Dawn of the Dead (1978) (European Version) and put into the mail to Madison.
10/23/2007 (T) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.

10/28/2007 (Su) - Watched The Gospel According to Philip K. Dick (2000) online. Worst animations ever.
10/29/2007 (M) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
10/31/2007 (W) - Received and watched the kick-a** Hot Fuzz (2007). Too bad they leave a plot point open, but ... Put into the mail to Madison.

11/06/2007 (T) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.

11/09/2007 (F) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.
11/10/2007 (Sa) - Received and watched Casablanca (1942). I should have watched it earlier. Put into the mail to Madison, but since there's no mail Monday ...
11/15/2007 (R) - Movie received by Netflix and the next one was shipped, since the mail person decided not to pick up outgoing mail on Tuesday ...
11/16/2007 (F) - Received and watched Death Proof (2007). Unfortunately, when this came out my sister said she'd watch Grindhouse with me, and I believed her. I don't know what was added on, but this film was longer than it needed to be. But, was fairly good. Put into the mail to Madison.
11/21/2007 (W) - Reported DVD as lost in the mail, since they still haven't received it.
11/22/2007 (R) - Watched Live Free or Die Hard (2007) outside of Netflix.
11/23/2007 (F) - Next movie shipped by Netflix.
11/24/2007 (Sa) - Received and watched A Hard Day's Night (1964) and put into the mail to Madison.

11/29/2007 (R) - Watched Requiem for a Dream (2000), outside of Netflix, thanks to Mr. Rob Lumley.
11/30/2007 (F) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.

The quality was good, but I couldn't get the main DVD menu to display. I did end up getting a smaller menu to come up, but I think it was just from what the PS3 read off of the DVD itself. When I went back in to review them ... no go. However, the audio was fine. I think Jason Statham is one of my favorite actors ...
12/03/2007 (M) - Next film mailed by Netflix.
12/04/2007 (T) - Received and watched Le Samourai (1967) and put into the mail to Madison. Another French film. And, rather good. However, I feel as though I'm missing something ... (a visit to the Wiki cleared it up, but a watching of the films included with the Criterion disc would also seem to do the same). Netflix also received the previous film, and put the next into the mail.
12/05/2007 (W) - Received and watched Planet Terror (2007) and put into the mail to Madison. Better than Death Proof, in my opinion.
12/06/2007 (R) - Movie received by Netflix, and next one shipped.
12/07/2007 (F) - Received next movie from Netflix, and Netflix received and mailed another movie.

12/14/2007 (F) - Movie received by Netflix and next one shipped.

item.title: 'If you surf around, you're bound to run into nothing but junk ...'
item.description:
So, the Isthmus picked up my post on Netflix.  That's very nice of them (I wonder how it was picked up?).  In the course of looking over the Isthmus' site, I noticed another post title "Dear City of Madison" Ouch. Reading his post first, and his profile second (which included his location), the title of this post came to mind.

Years ago, when both my sister and I were living at home, we'd fight, as siblings under one roof and with only one TV, often do.  Her time would be spent surfing around, from one channel to another.  As we got older, and we were both able to drive, she took that habit with her to the car and the radio.  (Thankfully, I'm older, so I never picked up her horrid habits.)

Anywho, Rad's post reminded me of my sister, and what I told her many times, about surfing through radio stations.  At first it was long, but as time passed, and my words had no impact on her, it shortened up.  To sum, "If you keep channel surfing, you're bound to keep running into commercials."  Id est, you're bound to keep running up against crap.  Sure, everyonce in a while you'll hit something good, but your chances of listening to the entire song are slim.  Only by picking a station and sticking with it are you truly able to determine whether the station is any good.

In Madison WI, we have a radio station which is an excellent example of this, 105-1 Charlie FM "We play everything".  And indeed they do.  70s, 80s, 90s, today.  Pop, rock, country, but (other than that one Aerosmith song) no rap that I know of ...  Heck, sometimes there's crap that I don't want to listen to, but if you stick around until the end of the song, you'll get something else.

Do we have a lot of country stations?  Yeah, yeah we do.  But, what do you expect from an area that, although we live in city, we play in the country?  I suppose that's one of the things that really separates us from the larger cities - the fact that we can spend a short time in the car and hit a lake or river, or a beautiful park, with trails.  Citizens of Madison do not have to sit around their houses, watching TV, or drive from one mall to another, listening to the radio.  We've got much more we can do.

Are we missing a great jazz station?  Perhaps.  I know NPR/WPR plays jazz every once in a while, and perhaps Magic 98 still plays jazz on Sundays?  (It's been a long time since I've listened to them.)  There's at least a couple UW stations that also play a wide range of music, so I doubt there isn't some jazz play on one of them.

Of course, our stations also move around a lot as well.  I think 98.1 and 104.1 are the only stations that haven't changed at least once since I've lived in the Madison area (over 10 years).  But we try new things, and we find a station that we like.  And we don't listen to one station all the time.  I've six presets on my car's radio, and they are all different.  There's two that I switch between a lot, but every once in a while I hit one of the others.  We like change in Madison, we're progressive.

Another great thing we've got is State St.  On the weekend, there are few places as musically rich as State St.  There's a great guy near the Capitol who plays one hell of a sax.  On the opposite end, bands setup near the University Bookstore, and towards the middle there's a number of places for groups to setup and play.  The various Unions, too, house many events.  Sitting off the lake, on a hot summer evening, listening to the music ...  Heck, concerts on the square.  On a good day, head over to Potbellies and listen to the music while you eat.  Heck, Madison WI is in a class by it's own.

Rad comments on two stations in his article: The Current (which appears to be MPR - or WPR here in Wisconsin, so we've got that) and Drive 105 (which appears to be alternative, which we've also had, and I'm sure have still).  To this, I answer, read the title of this post.  One likes a station not based on their first impression, but on the impressions of many hours.  You may stop and listen to a station if you stumble upon a song you enjoy, but you don't stay on a station after hearing that one song - it's a number of good songs that keeps bringing you back.

So, spend more time in Madison.  Move to a station and stick with it.  If you're down in Madison to see Madison-ians, then listen to the stations they listen to.  You're bound to run into songs that you don't like, but that's the way it is ...  Head downtown, and check out postings.  There's bound to be a local group putting on a show that's in line with your tastes.

In short, do our stations suck?  Sometimes, sure.  But find a large city that doesn't have some, some of the time.  Besides, we've got a nice mix of stations, and a beautiful city that ensures we can find something to listen to.

item.title: Netflix shipping, for Madison WI
item.description:
Over the next couple of weeks, at least, or over the next couple of months, if I'm happy with Netflix, I'll be posting here information about where I received my Netflix movies from, what kind of turn-around I've received, and etcetera. My hope is that this information will be beneficial to other Madison folks who may be interested in Netflix.

I've signed up for the $9.99 plan, which offers unlimited rentals, but one DVD out at a time. (Update: This also includes 10 hours, per billing period, of online viewing.) (Update 7/31/2007: The price went down to $8.99 a month, which also means that there's only 9 hours of online viewing per month. Eh.) I've got 19 movies in my queue - some that I've seen, some that I have not. (Note: queue number is horribly out of date.) Some are classics, some are newer. Some are obscure, some are quite popular. Since I've got a two week preview, I figure I may as well keep the queue nice and full.

Know of some classic flicks I should see (by classic, in this case, I'll mean pre-1970)? Post them below! 

The times

09/26/2006 (T) - Signed up. First movie expected to ship Wednesday, with expected delivery of one day. 19 movies in queue, plus one saved.
09/27/2006 (W) - First movie expected to be delivered on Thursday. 18 movies remaining in queue, plus 12 added for a total of 30, plus one saved.
09/28/2006 (R) - First movie received and watched (Urusei Yatsura Movie 2: Beautiful Dreamer). Repackaged and shipped to PO Box 7997, Madison WI 53707-7997.
10/02/2006 (M) - Movie returned and another sent. Expected delivery on Tuesday.
10/03/2006 (T) - Second movie received and watched (Seven Samurai: Criterion Collection). Repackaged and sent to same address as before.
10/05/2006 (R) - Third movie expected to be delivered on Friday.
10/06/2006 (F) - Third movie received and watched (Being John Malkovich). Repackaged and shipped to PO Box 3079, Milwaukee WI 53201-9683 (which is a different facility).
10/09/2006 (M) - Movie received by Netflix. Next movie expected to ship today and delivered Wednesday.
10/10/2006 (T) - Fourth movie received and watched (Bowling for Columbine). Repackaged and shipped to PO Box 7997, Madison WI 53707-7997.
Charged $10.54 for the month, which equates to 3 or 4 movies during my trial.
10/12/2006 (R) - Movie received by Netflix and next movie expected to be delivered Friday.
10/13/2006 (F) - Fifth movie received and watched (Grave of the Fireflies). Repackaged and shipped to Madison, same PO Box as above.
10/16/2006 (M) - Movie received by Netflix and next movie expected to be delivered Tuesday.

10/19/2006 (R) - Movie received by Netflix and next movie expected to be delivered Friday.

item.title: How Charter Madison stacks up - Speedtest.net
item.description:
On CNET this morning I ran across Speedtest.net.  Like sites and tools that have come before it, it's meant to test connection speeds between one computer and another.  Unlike previous ones, however, the UI is much more attactive (i.e., more Web 2.0-like).

If you haven't tried it out yet, I recommend you do so.  My results from Charter, in Madison WI, are below.

It'll be interesting to see just how long this stays up.  It's been Dugg and /.'d, and it's still giving fairly accurate numbers.  But, can the site stay up with just AdSense?  What are their costs?

How does your connection compare?

Update September 2, 2007 @ 11:18

A little over a year later, here's my updated numbers.
